topics.title: Ergo Development State and Five-Year Vision
topics.summary: kushti discusses the current state of Ergo development, highlighting improvements in node stability and ErgoScript adoption. He outlines plans for layer 2 solutions, better developer tooling, and research into NIPoPoWs and cross-chain interoperability for the next five years.

topics.title: Palmyra Real-World Asset Tokenization Platform
topics.summary: Dan explains Palmyra's focus on bringing real-world assets on-chain through tokenization and DeFi primitives. The platform leverages Ergo's UTXO model for commodity financing and supply chain management, integrating with Oracle Pools and Rosen Bridge.

topics.title: Trade House Order Book vs AMM Comparison
topics.summary: qx() explains how Trade House's order book model differs from AMM-based exchanges like Spectrum. Order books provide better transparency, market depth visibility, and avoid impermanent loss while enabling sophisticated trading strategies.

topics.title: Bulletproofs Integration for Privacy-Preserving Contracts
topics.summary: kushti explains bulletproofs as zero-knowledge proofs without trusted setup, particularly useful for range proofs. He's working on implementing bulletproof verification in ErgoScript to enable privacy-preserving applications like verifiable credentials.

topics.title: Chainlink Partnership Strategy and Oracle Pool Investment
topics.summary: Dan clarifies Palmyra's pragmatic approach to using both Chainlink for specific functions like proof of reserve and IoT monitoring, while also investing in Ergo's native Oracle Pool infrastructure. The strategy involves using the right tool for each specific use case.

topics.title: Ergo Scaling Solutions and Block Time Optimization
topics.summary: kushti discusses draft proposals for scaling improvements including sub-blocks and microblocks, optimized for real Ergo applications rather than abstract use cases. He addresses the impact of faster blocks on existing contracts and calls for community involvement in testnet parameter testing.

topics.title: Trade House Partial Fill Mechanism
topics.summary: qx() explains how Trade House handles partial fills automatically on-chain, creating new boxes with remaining tokens at the same price level. This enables complex trading strategies and systematic buying across multiple price levels without central authority.

topics.title: DDoS and Spam Attack Prevention Mechanisms
topics.summary: kushti outlines Ergo's built-in protections against spam attacks, including peer transaction limits, mempool filters, and adjustable minimum propagation fees. The system allows honest users to pay slightly more during spam periods while dropping low-fee spam transactions.

topics.title: Multi-Chain Strategy and Ecosystem Growth Philosophy
topics.summary: Dan discusses balancing multi-chain partnerships with Ergo ecosystem commitment. He argues against tribalistic responses to multi-chain projects, emphasizing that welcoming companies using multiple tools can help Ergo become a foundational layer for other projects.

topics.title: Future Development Priorities and Real-World Applications
topics.summary: All speakers share their priorities for the next year: kushti focuses on real-world applications and zero-knowledge integration, Dan on Winter Protocol commodity financing, and qx() on expanding order book trading beyond just token swaps to NFTs and unique assets.

topics.title: Rosen Bridge Permit Transaction Issues
topics.summary: Dan addresses a technical issue with Rosen Bridge involving a high-fee transaction that failed due to a missed signature. The team is working on resolving the issue and refunding permits to affected users as part of mainnet preparation testing.
